result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Charvel Green Sr SR was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate.
-Maintain employment of at least 24 hours per week.
-Pay supervision fees.

Sheriff's Dept. has advised defendant has 387 days credit. DA notified by clerk. On Court's direction, judgment amended to reflect sentence credit of 387 days. DOC in Madision notified by clerk.

Defendant Antonio Charvel Green Sr in court, in custody by video conference from Flambeau Correctional.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court discussion regarding consecutive/concurrent sentence. At time of sentencing, Court did not order sentence consecutive, therefore it runs concurrent. Defendant requests additional 295 days sentence credit, was previously given 70 days credit. Court will review jail records and determine sentence credit, will have amended judgment prepared, if necessary. Motion to modify sentence denied.

Defendant Antonio Charvel Green in court with attorney Wilfred P de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time. Defedandant does not qualify for public defender representation. State requests $7500 cash bail with conditions:  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers. Attorney Dejunco informs defendant is under a probation hold at this time and bail may be moot.     Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
